comments:
3.0.2 RC2

- opened existing workspace in d:\eclipse-3.0.1\plugins
- launched, and exited target (this is probably irrelevant)
- did some development
- wanted to hide java.awt* from code assist / quick fix
- in the Type Filters pref page, pressed Add Packages
- got an error dialog and the following in the log

I have org.eclipse.debug.ui loaded in my workspace.
The Info properties page shows its location as:
d:\eclipse-3.0.1\plugins\org.eclipse.debug.ui

So I'm not sure where it's getting
D:\eclipse-M20040908\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.debug.ui_3.0.1\dtui.jar

I haven't changed the PDE Target Platform -- it points to the current install:
d:\eclipse-SDK-3.0.2RC2\eclipse

Created an attachment (id=18666)
The JDT core prefs file

From
D:\eclipse-3.0.1\plugins\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs


This has several "D\:/eclipse-M2004*" refs
The file is also very large for a prefs file: 169K

I tried closing and reopening the org.eclipse.debug.ui project, but that had no
effect.
Deleting org.eclipse.debug.ui fixed up the problem.

There is little JDT/UI can do here. We are catching the exception we get from
JDT/Core showing an error dialog and log it. 

Moving to JDT/Core to check why they are pointing to the stale entries.
Could you please provide your workspace as a test case?

Cannot reproduce either in an existing or brand new workspace where I
checked-out org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui...

Furthermore, there's only one reference to dtui.jar file in preference file you
attached in comment 1:
path\="D\:/eclipse-SDK-3.0.2RC2/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.debug.ui_3.0.2/dtui.jar"
which sounds quite correct vue to your PDE Target Platform.

My opinion is that it's related to previous error message in log file:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 271 Mar 10, 2005 14:03:28.811
!MESSAGE File not found:
D:\eclipse-M20040908\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.debug.ui_3.0.1\plugin.xml.

It seems that there was some issue while loading/checking out
org.eclipse.debug.ui and this plugin was wrongly located in
D:\eclipse-M20040908\eclipse\plugins instead of d:\eclipse-3.0.1\plugins.

Move to PDE/Core for comments how this kind of situation may happen or move to
right component...

I've copied the zip'ed workspace to my public dir on Novell, under
workspaces/87639.zip.

Note that this was after deleting org.eclipse.debug.ui though, so this may not
be too helpful.
we don't have a reproducible test case here and it's also an oldie so I'm closing this one.
